name: India Gate
description: The India Gate is a war memorial located astride the Rajpath, on the eastern edge of the ‘ceremonial axis’ of New Delhi, formerly called Kingsway. It stands as a memorial to 82,000 soldiers of the British Indian Army who died between 1914 and 1921 in the First World War.
historicalSignificance: The India Gate is a memorial to the soldiers of the British Indian Army who died in World War I and the Third Anglo-Afghan War.
travelTips: Visit in the evening for the light show.
safetyInfo: Generally safe, but be aware of your surroundings.
photographersTips: Best time for photography is during sunrise and sunset.
